suncertify.db.lock
Class LockManager

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.db.lock.LockManager

public final class LockManager
extends java.lang.Object

Component for the management of record locks.

The operations to lock and unlock a record are delegated by the Data implementation to an instance of this class. Internally, lock information is stored in a static hashmap, mapping record numbers to record locks. This map needs to be static so that information about lock can be shared between several Data instances. Access to the map needs to be appropriately synchronized.

Method Detail

lock

public long lock(long recNo)
Acquires the lock on the record with the given index and returns the value of the lock. This method blocks until the lock succeeds.

Threads trying to acquire a lock are synchronized on the corresponding DataRecordLock instance. I.e. if a lock is already held by another thread the calling thread suspends execution and must be notified when the lock is released.

This implementation does not test whether a record with the given index does exist at all or whether it is deleted. It is possible to lock on any index of a record, and it is the responsibility of the caller to ensure that it is only called with valid indices.

Parameters:
recNo - index of the record to be locked
Returns:
cookie value of the lock after it is acquired

unlock

public void unlock(long recNo,
                   long cookie)
            throws SecurityException
Releases the lock on the record with the given index. If the caller cannot prove lock ownership by presenting the correct cookie value, a SecurityException is thrown.

Parameters:
recNo - index of the record
cookie - cookie value of the lock
Throws:
SecurityException - if the record was locked with a cookie value other than the specified cookie value

validateCookie

public void validateCookie(long recNo,
                           long cookie)
                    throws SecurityException
Checks if the record with the specified number is locked with the specified cookie value. If the correct cookie value is used, the method simply returns. If the wrong cookie value is supplied, a SecurityException is thrown.

Parameters:
recNo - number of the record
cookie - lock cookie value
Throws:
SecurityException - if the record is locked with a cookie other than the specified lockCookie
